availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Francis Manville Webster (Campbell County, Kentucky, attorney.)

body.p: Campbell County, Kentucky, attorney. New York native. Son of Waite Webster and Sarah Manville Webster. Married to Ann E. Swiney Webster. Father of Mary Alice Webster, S. Nazarene Webster, York Webster, F. Gertrude Webster, Katie Webster, and Anna Webster. Attorney in Campbell County, Kentucky, in 1850. Owned one enslaved person in Campbell County in 1850. Attorney in Campbell County in 1860. Owned two enslaved persons in Campbell County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Campbell County, Newport, p. 44A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Campbell County, Newport.

Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Campbell County, Newport, p. 237A.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Campbell County, Newport, p. 381B.
Lineage Book: National Society of the Daughters of the American Revolution, vol. IX (Harrisburg, PA: Press of Harrisburg Publishing Company, 1899), 152-3.
